Description: A model copper harpoon-blade: roughly cut from thin sheet copper, with barbs.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, 12, 28, pl.IXA, 5. For other examples, see W. M. F. Petrie, 'Tools and weapons : illustrated by the Egyptian collection in University College, London' (London, 1917), 37 and pl.XLIV, 36-7; E. Amélineau, ‘Les Nouvelles Fouilles d’Abydos’ II (1896-7), pl.XVIII, 8; L. Grinsell, 'Guide Catalogue Bristol', 26, fig.9; W. C. Hayes, 'The scepter of Egypt : a background for the study of the Egyptian antiquities in the Metropolitan Museum of Art' I (Cambridge, Mass, 1953), 46, fig. 36; A. Scharff, ‘Die Altertümer der Vor – und Frühzeit Ägyptens’ I (Berlin, 1929), no.126 and pl.7.
